intro: Metastelma virgatum, commonly known as the redroot false mallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its upright stems, heart-shaped leaves, and showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural use.
